Articles.Content: Thanks for all the answers to my questions! This community is so helpful in getting people up to speed. (no pun intended)

Thanks for all the answers to my questions! This community is so helpful in getting people up to speed. (no pun intended)

SPEED?!

*Turns on boosters*
Mine can make it, land successfully and take off again. Now I just need to work on my aim back to Kerbin.

My RCS lander made it, with a lot of overkill.

3-4 landings so far, 1 landing without return. The wreckage you see is my upper stage / descend stage, which did it\'s work till 20 meters above the surface. Did not use any fuel whatsoever on my intended descent stage. Used it for ascent, which turned out to be good, because some of that fuel was used when I stupidly escaped from moon orbit in the direction of the moon\'s orbit... a few seconds later, get recaptured. auch. But, Thanks to overkill, I made it back safely.

Just heard about the experimental release.

Welp. I might go wait for the official release to get things done 8)
sucessful first mission of the Freyja rocket
For some reason my perfect rocket now blows itself up on booster separation! Why Harv, why!

not good candidate

You should have used my charts...

But no! No one trusts electricity anymore.

My Ghibli 343L, amazingly, took me to the far side on the first try. With the keyboard (!)

I was piloting from a high angle, and seeing the engine plume light up the terrain when I was touching down was a great surprise

Though, I need either better navigation systems to avoid inefficient maneuvers (my Moon capture was hardly efficient...) or a good weight reduction program for the upper stage, since I landed with just a bit less fuel than needed for Munar escape velocity.

Well, I always have my Nova class if needed, the 444L, but I believe that I can get away with less
Where are the pics from the surface of the moon coming from?!!!!!!!??????!!!!!?????

from the Mun, of course.

Any newer features?

Any newer features?

Don\'t keep up with the development subforum?

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=3683.msg40772#msg40772

Keep in mind its experimental, and thus buggy, currently some weird orbital bugs.

New features were:

The Mun

Rotating planets; Kerbin, Mun

Star has gravity, Kerbin orbits it - (No physical model yet, just light)

Engines can be vector thrust (gimballing)

No I meant more like vanilla lander parts, I think Harv said something about lander parts somewhere, but I don\'t know.
So yeah

-snip-

So yeah

I thought about using a runaway booster too, but then remembered it only got you up to about 100 m/s. get about 5 stacked up and you\'ll be good.

I thought about using a runaway booster too, but then remembered it only got you up to about 100 m/s. get about 5 stacked up and you\'ll be good.

The problem wasn\'t that the escape tower wasn\'t powerful enough. It was only meant to get the pod off the surface for the ascent thruster to fire.

The problem was that, for some reason, the ascent thruster was ripped off in the process.

Go to downloads and go to the bottom of the page.
I have now sucsessfully landed my kerbalized n1 ;D (k1) hereÂ´s a few pics of the complete rocket, third stage and lander in munar orbit and of the rocket on final approach and landing

I have a personal belief that anything less than overkill just isn\'t the Kerbal way. With that being said, I made a rocket that uses only stock parts aside from the lander itself, which is the MunLander by MaryG.

I enjoyed the challenge of such a heavy lander in comparison to things that could be made with stock parts.

I\'ve made it in various formats, but this was the most straightforward. KW challenger pack fuel tanks and engines, moaches SRB with the KW pack 1m core SRB CFG file, KW lander, Sunday Punch decouplers, and 1 stock SAS. Engine gimbals causes it to shake itself apart if you use an ASAS.

The long core stage has almost exactly the right amount of Delta V to orbit kerbin, then accelerate to a mun intercept. The second stage fuel tank is solely for mun orbit insertion of bleeding off velocity before landing.

Props to Kyle and Winston for their packs. The lander is very nice. While you\'re locked into one format with it, combining descent tank and lander legs means no chance of a leg snapping off if things go awry just before touch down.
